DOC.brief_summary: The main purpose of this cross-sectional study is to generate data to support the psychometric properties of the Suicide Ideation and Behavior Assessment Tool (SIBAT) and validate its use in participants at imminent risk of suicide.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Validation and Mapping of the Suicide Ideation and Behavior Assessment
DOC.criteria: Participant must be able to speak, read, and write English sufficiently well to complete consent process and selfadminister study questionnaires Each participant must sign an informed consent form (ICF) indicating that he or she understands the purpose of the interviews and, when applicable, the videotaping required for the study and are willing to participate in the study. Adolescents (minors) who in the judgment of the investigator are capable of understanding the nature of the study can be enrolled only after obtaining consent of a legally acceptable representative. Assent must be obtained from any participating adolescents (minors) Each participant or legally acceptable representative must check a separate box on the consent form if he or she agrees to have interviews videorecorded. Participants who do not consent to video recording will only be administered the SIBAT Participant has any clinically relevant physical or mental conditions including, but not limited to vision problems, physical disability, severe mental illness, or cognitive impairment (such as from acute intoxication or dementia) which, in the opinion of the investigator, would interfere with ability to complete the study interviews
